assignment was generated"}},"constructor":{"params":{"tokenAddress":"address of the PET token to connect to the contract"}},"createPartition(uint256)":{"params":{"l":"the number of clusters to create"}},"generateAssignments(uint256)":{"params":{"m":"the number of reviews assigned to each user"}},"getAllocations()":{"returns":{"_0":"the list of possible allocations and a list of their corresponding probabilities of being selected"}},"getAssignmentById(uint256)":{"params":{"id":"the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set"},"returns":{"_0":"the list of proposals assigned for the review to the id specified"}},"getAssignmentByToken(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"the token id corresponding to the proposal for which the assignment is required"},"returns":{"_0":"the list of proposals assigned for the review to the owner of the token identified by tokenId"}},"getCurrentPhase()":{"returns":{"_0":"a value from the Phases enumeration, representing current state of the contract"}},"getPartition()":{"returns":{"_0":"the unzipped version of partition data structure, storing clusters"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getTokenAddress()":{"returns":{"_0":"the address locating the token contract"}},"getWorkById(uint256)":{"params":{"id":"the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set"},"returns":{"_0":"the work stored in the proposals set related to the id provided"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"impartialSelection(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"k":"the number of winners to select","randomness":"the randomness used to select the allocation of winners per cluster to use"}},"isImpartialSelection()":{"returns":{"_0":"the value resulting from the check"}},"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"data":"eventual data transferred","from":"the owner of the token","operator":"the address transferring the token","tokenId":"the token id"},"returns":{"_0":"the selector of the function"}},"provideAssignments(uint256[][])":{"params":{"assignments":"the assignment to be stored"}},"providePartition(uint256[][])":{"params":{"part":"the partition to be stored"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revealEvaluations(uint256,uint256,uint256[],uint256[])":{"params":{"evaluations":"scores used to generate the commitment","randomness":"randomness used to generate the commitment","tokenId":"token used during the commitment phase, to retrieve the corresponding commitment"},"returns":{"_0":"the evaluations provided"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"setCurrentPhase(uint8)":{"params":{"p":"the phase the contract should be put in"}},"submitWork(bytes)":{"params":{"work":"the work an agent wishes to submit"}}},"title":"Impartial Selection noStorage implementation","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"commitEvaluations(bytes32,uint256)":{"notice":"stores a commitment of the evaluations for the assigned reviews on the blockchain, after verifying that the user is authorized"},"constructor":"creates a new instance of the contract","createPartition(uint256)":{"notice":"creates a partition of the proposals using the algorithm defined in the library"},"endAssignmentPhase()":{"notice":"ends assignment phase and starts commitment phase"},"endCommitmentPhase()":{"notice":"ends commitment phase and starts reveal phase"},"endRevealPhase()":{"notice":"ends the reveal phase and checks that everyone submitted their scores"},"endSubmissionPhase()":{"notice":"ends submission phase and starts assignment phase"},"finalizeCreation()":{"notice":"sets the following contract as a minter for PET tokens"},"generateAssignments(uint256)":{"notice":"creates the review assignments to the proposals using the algorithm defined in the library"},"getAllocations()":{"notice":"getter returning the different possible combinations of winners per cluster found by the apportionment algorithm"},"getAssignmentById(uint256)":{"notice":"getter returning the reviews assignment correponding to a given proposal id"},"getAssignmentByToken(uint256)":{"notice":"getter returning the reviews assignment correponding to a given tokenId"},"getCurrentPhase()":{"notice":"getter returning the current phase of the contract"},"getPartition()":{"notice":"getter returning the clusters in which the proposals are divided"},"getTokenAddress()":{"notice":"getter returning the token contract"},"getWorkById(uint256)":{"notice":"getter returning the work proposed by a specified proposal id"},"impartialSelection(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"executes the actual selection by invoking Exact Dollar Partition"},"isImpartialSelection()":{"notice":"used by the token to check if the invoking contract is an instance of an impartial selection contract"},"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"callback invoked on receiving a token"},"provideAssignments(uint256[][])":{"notice":"provides an externally created assignment of the reviews to store on the blockchain"},"providePartition(uint256[][])":{"notice":"provides an externally created partition of the proposals to store on the blockchain"},"revealEvaluations(uint256,uint256,uint256[],uint256[])":{"notice":"performs the reveal operation and updates the scores"},"setCurrentPhase(uint8)":{"notice":"updates the current phase of the contract"},"submitWork(bytes)":{"notice":"used to submit a work to the system and to receive the corresponding token minted"}},"notice":"smart contract implementing the system proposed, using no data structures for storing documentation.text:
@notice creates a new instance of the contract
 @param tokenAddress address of the PET token to connect to the contract

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (mapping(uint256 => bool),uint256[] storage ref[] storage pointer,mapping(uint256 => uint256))

documentation.text: @notice ends the reveal phase and checks that everyone submitted their scores

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Proposals.Set storage pointer,uint256) view returns (uint256)

attributes.text:
@notice creates a new instance of the contract
 @param tokenAddress address of the PET token to connect to the contract
@notice ends the reveal phase and checks that everyone submitted their scores

attributes.type: function (mapping(uint256 => bool),uint256[] storage ref[] storage pointer,mapping(uint256 => uint256))
function (struct Proposals.Set storage pointer,uint256) view returns (uint256)

params.tokenId: the token id associated to the proposal for which the assignment was generated

params.tokenAddress: address of the PET token to connect to the contract

params.l: the number of clusters to create

params.m: the number of reviews assigned to each user

returns._0: the list of possible allocations and a list of their corresponding probabilities of being selected

params.id: the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set

returns._0: the list of proposals assigned for the review to the id specified

params.tokenId: the token id corresponding to the proposal for which the assignment is required

returns._0: the list of proposals assigned for the review to the owner of the token identified by tokenId
a value from the Phases enumeration, representing current state of the contract
the unzipped version of partition data structure, storing clusters

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

returns._0: the address locating the token contract

params.id: the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set

returns._0: the work stored in the proposals set related to the id provided

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.k: the number of winners to select
params.randomness: the randomness used to select the allocation of winners per cluster to use

returns._0: the value resulting from the check

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

params.evaluations: scores used to generate the commitment
params.randomness: randomness used to generate the commitment
params.tokenId: token used during the commitment phase, to retrieve the corresponding commitment

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.p: the phase the contract should be put in

params.work: the work an agent wishes to submit

commitEvaluations(bytes32,uint256).notice: stores a commitment of the evaluations for the assigned reviews on the blockchain, after verifying that the user is authorized

methods.constructor: creates a new instance of the contract

createPartition(uint256).notice: creates a partition of the proposals using the algorithm defined in the library

endAssignmentPhase().notice: ends assignment phase and starts commitment phase

endCommitmentPhase().notice: ends commitment phase and starts reveal phase

endRevealPhase().notice: ends the reveal phase and checks that everyone submitted their scores

endSubmissionPhase().notice: ends submission phase and starts assignment phase

finalizeCreation().notice: sets the following contract as a minter for PET tokens

generateAssignments(uint256).notice: creates the review assignments to the proposals using the algorithm defined in the library

getAllocations().notice: getter returning the different possible combinations of winners per cluster found by the apportionment algorithm

getAssignmentById(uint256).notice: getter returning the reviews assignment correponding to a given proposal id

getAssignmentByToken(uint256).notice: getter returning the reviews assignment correponding to a given tokenId

getCurrentPhase().notice: getter returning the current phase of the contract

getPartition().notice: getter returning the clusters in which the proposals are divided

getWorkById(uint256).notice: getter returning the work proposed by a specified proposal id

impartialSelection(uint256,uint256).notice: executes the actual selection by invoking Exact Dollar Partition

isImpartialSelection().notice: used by the token to check if the invoking contract is an instance of an impartial selection contract

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.notice: callback invoked on receiving a token

provideAssignments(uint256[][]).notice: provides an externally created assignment of the reviews to store on the blockchain

providePartition(uint256[][]).notice: provides an externally created partition of the proposals to store on the blockchain

revealEvaluations(uint256,uint256,uint25.notice: performs the reveal operation and updates the scores

setCurrentPhase(uint8).notice: updates the current phase of the contract

submitWork(bytes).notice: used to submit a work to the system and to receive the corresponding token minted

userdoc.notice: smart contract implementing the system proposed, using no data structures for storing scores
